page.title: 07Summer Fishing in Newquay
page.content:
The harbour is quite busy in the summer when many tourists come to go shark or mackeral fishing or to do other deep-sea sports.
Many men work in the summer catching shellfish,lobsters,crabs and crayfish.At the height of the season six tons a week are caught,sold at Newlyn and sent to London.Some are sold for a higher profit in the French markets.
Porth reservoir is a secluded 40 acres lake nestling in a small,wooded valley near Colon only ten minutes' drive from the centre of Newquay.The South West Water Authority uses the reservoir as a 'put and take' trout fly fishery.During the 1985 season the fishery will be stocked with over 4000 rainbow trout.
